template&lt; class CharT, class Traits &gt;
std::basic_ostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;&amp; emit_on_flush( std::basic_ostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;&amp; os );

{{dcl| num=2 | since=c++20|
template&lt; class CharT, class Traits &gt;

If {{c|os.rdbuf()}} actually points to a {{c|std::basic_syncbuf&lt;CharT, Traits, Allocator&gt;}} {{tt|buf}}, toggles whether it emits (i.e., transmits data to the underlying stream buffer) when flushed:
@1@ calls {{c|buf.set_emit_on_sync(true)}}
@2@ calls {{c|buf.set_emit_on_sync(false)}}

Otherwise, these manipulators have no effect.

This is an output-only I/O manipulator, it may be called with an expression such as {{c|out &lt;&lt; std::emit_on_flush}} for any {{tt|out}} of type {{lc|std::basic_ostream}}.


===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | os | reference to output stream }}
{{par end}}

===Return value===

{{tt|os}} (reference to the stream after manipulation)
